title: Jennifer Aniston chokes up as she pays tribute to Bill Paxton at Oscars ceremony
text:
Jennifer Aniston chokes up as she pays tribute to Bill Paxton at Oscars ceremony The Friends star introduced the annual In Memoriam segment at the 89th Academy Awards on Sunday Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Jen Aniston chokes up as she introduces in memoriam segment Share this video Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
Jennifer Aniston was on the verge of tears as she paid tribute to Bill Paxton at the Oscars. 
The Friends star was chosen to introduce the In Memoriam segment at the 89th annual Academy Awards on Sunday. 
Speaking onstage at the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood, the actress said, “Each and every one was a cherished member of our beloved family,” before choking up as she remembered Bill, who passed away on Saturday. 
During the segment, stars including Mary Tyler Moore, Carrie Fisher, Debbie Reynolds, Robert Vaughn, Gene Wilder, Garry Marshall, Garry Shandling and more were remembered as Sara Bareilles sang a rendition of Both Sides Now by Joni Mitchell. Jennifer Aniston introduces the "In Memoriam" segment (Photo: REUTERS) 
After the sad news of Bill's death emerged on Sunday morning, tributes came flooding in from fellow actors. 
His True Lies co-star Jamie Lee Curtis wrote: "N . Bill Paxton is gone. Such a funny, talented, loving human. Louise & the children & family my [love] & support 2 u. #truelies (sic)" 
Breaking Bad actor Aaron Paul remembered one of the "greatest guys" he'd ever met. Jennifer Aniston introduces the "In Memoriam" segment (Photo: AFP) Actors Jennifer Aniston (L) and Justin Theroux (Photo: Getty Images North America) Read More Bill Paxton was all smiles during his last red carpet appearance - just TWO weeks before his death 
He wrote: "Bill Paxton was hands down one of the greatest guys that I have ever met. I feel lucky to have called him my friend. Bill, I love you. RIP. (sic)" 
Lou Diamond Phillips posted: "I am stunned & saddened at the passing of Bill Paxton. I just worked with him recently. A warm and beautiful soul and a talented actor. RIP (sic)" (Photo: Rex Features) Who won Oscars at the 2017 Academy Awards? Full winners list 
And Zach Braff wrote: "Bill Paxton. A very talented man. As skilled with comedy as he was with drama. Carpe Diem. #rip (sic)" 
The actor was best known for his work on movies including Titanic, Apollo 13, Aliens, Predator 2, and The Terminator. 
Bill also starred in TV drama Big Love and the small screen adaptation of Training Day, and he won an Emmy award for his performance in historical TV miniseries Hatfields & McCoys. 
A statement released by his family on Sunday read: “A loving husband and father, Bill began his career in Hollywood working on films in the art department and went on to have an illustrious career spanning four decades as a beloved and prolific actor and film-maker. 
“Bill’s passion for the arts was felt by all who knew him, and his warmth and tireless energy were undeniable. We ask to please respect the family’s wish for privacy as they mourn the loss of their adored husband and father.”
